# Copilot Instructions for TrashGènero OS

## Project Overview
TrashGènero OS is a fashion, cult, and chaos operating system project ("Sistema Operativo de Moda, Culto y Caos").

## Tech Stack
- JavaScript/Node.js based project
- Standard Node.js tooling and package management

## Project Structure
- Root contains standard Node.js configuration files
- `.gitignore` follows Node.js best practices

## Coding Standards and Conventions

### General Guidelines
- Follow JavaScript/Node.js best practices
- Keep code simple and maintainable
- Write clear, descriptive commit messages

### File Organization
- Use standard Node.js project structure
- Keep configuration files in the root directory
- Store GitHub-specific files in `.github/` directory

### Dependencies
- Only add necessary dependencies
- Keep dependencies up to date
- Document any new dependencies added

## Development Workflow

### Before Making Changes
- Always check existing project structure and conventions
- Review related code before making modifications
- Run existing linters and tests if available

### Code Changes
- Make minimal, focused changes
- Test changes thoroughly
- Ensure backward compatibility when possible

### Documentation
- Update documentation when making significant changes
- Keep README.md current with project status
- Document any new features or breaking changes

## Testing
- If tests exist, run them before and after changes
- Add tests for new functionality
- Ensure all tests pass before committing

## Pull Requests
- Create clear, descriptive PR titles
- Include detailed descriptions of changes
- Reference related issues when applicable
- Keep PRs focused on a single concern

## Project-Specific Context
This is a creative/experimental project exploring the intersection of fashion, cult culture, and chaos through an operating system metaphor. Approach the project with creativity while maintaining code quality and functionality.
